parameter.name: service-instance-identifier
parameter.SemanticDefinition: This parameter reports the identifier of the given service instance.

parameter.name: delivery-mode
parameter.SemanticDefinition: This enumerated parameter reports the delivery mode of the given instance of the F-CLTU service. For the present version of this service only the ‘forward online’ delivery mode is defined.

parameter.name: return-timeout-period
parameter.SemanticDefinition: This parameter reports the setting of the maximum time period in seconds permitted from when a confirmed F-CLTU operation is invoked until the return is received by the invoker.

parameter.name: notification-mode
protocol-abort-mode
maximum-cltu-length
parameter.SemanticDefinition: This parameter reports the maximum length in octets that a CLTU may have to be accepted by the F-CLTU service provider for the given service instance.

parameter.name: minimum-delay-time
parameter.SemanticDefinition: This parameter reports the minimum time, in microseconds, that the service provider will ensure between the completion of the radiation of one CLTU and the beginning of the radiation of the following CLTU. The exact effect of the delay time depending on the PLOP is further described in the F-CLTU specification CCSDS 912.1-B-3.

parameter.typeDefinition: SEQUENCE (SIZE (1)) OF IntUnsigned (0 .. 2) { unbound (0) , ready (1) , active (2) }
parameter.name: si-state
reporting-cycle
parameter.SemanticDefinition: This parameter reports the current setting of the time in seconds between successive CLTU-STATUS-REPORT invocations sent by the F-CLTU service provider. The permissible values are in the range (2 .. 600). If cyclic reporting is off, the value reported is undefined.

parameter.typeDefinition: SEQUENCE (SIZE (1)) OF IntUnsigned (0 .. 3) { configured (0) , operational (1) , interrupted (2) , halted (3) }
parameter.name: production-status

parameter.typeDefinition: SEQUENCE (SIZE (1)) OF IntUnsigned (0 .. 3) { forward-link-status-not-available (0) , no-rf-available (1) , no-bit-lock (2) , nominal (3) }
parameter.name: forward-link-status
clcw-physical-channel
parameter.SemanticDefinition: This parameter reports the name assigned to the physical channel carrying the CLCW. This name is a Visible String which has a length of 1 to 32 characters.

parameter.typeDefinition: SEQUENCE (SIZE (3)) OF IntUnsigned, where the first element is the SCID (0 .. 1023), the second element is the TFVN (0 .. 1); and the third element is the VCID (0 .. 63). As to have a way for expressing also the selection of the Master Channel, the 'special' VCID value 99 is used to indicate that the VCID may have any value. Therefore the exact range specification is: VCID ϵ {0 .. 63,99}
parameter.name: clcw-global-vcid
rf-available-required
bit-lock-required
plop-in-effect
parameter.SemanticDefinition: This enumerated parameter reports the Physical Layer Operation Procedure (PLOP) that the F-CLTU service provider applies. This parameter can take on two values: - 'plop1'; - plop2. The exact behavior of the provider as determined by the selected PLOP in effect is further described in the F-CLTU specification CCSDS 912.1-B-3.

parameter.name: acquisition-sequence-length
parameter.SemanticDefinition: This parameter reports the size, in octets, of the bit pattern to be radiated to enable the spacecraft telecommand system to achieve bit lock. The radiation of the acquisition sequence will be performed in accordance with the applicable Physical Layer Operations Procedure (PLOP) - cf. plop-in-effect.

parameter.name: plop1-idle-sequence-length
parameter.SemanticDefinition: This parameter reports the length, in octets, of the idle sequence that the F-CLTU service provider shall radiate after radiation of the acquisition sequence and whenever the radiation of a CLTU completed, provided plop-in-effect = 'plop1'. If the parameter value is zero, no idle sequence is applied.

parameter.name: expected-cltu-identification
parameter.SemanticDefinition: This parameter reports the value of the cltu-identification the F-CLTU service provider expects to receive in the next CLTU-TRANSFER-DATA invocation for this invocation to be valid. As long as si-state ≠ 'active', the value reported will be zero.

parameter.name: expected-event-invocation-identification
parameter.SemanticDefinition: This parameter reports the value of the event-invocation-identification the F-CLTU service provider expects to receive in the next CLTU-THROW-EVENT invocation for this invocation to be valid. The initial value of this parameter is zero.

parameter.name: number-of-cltus-received
parameter.SemanticDefinition: This parameter reports the total number of CLTUs received while the given service instance is currently made accessible to the users. Only CLTUs that the service provider accepted and consequently buffered are counted in the total.

parameter.name: number-of-cltus-processed
number-of-cltus-radiated
parameter.SemanticDefinition: This parameter reports the number of CLTUs that the provider successfully radiated completely during the service provision period. A CLTU in the process of being radiated is not included in this count.
